entry.title: In search of lost languages
entry.content:
npr:

“There are about 175 indigenous languages still spoken in the United States and a vast majority of them are on the verge of extinction.” A Road Trip In Search Of America’s Lost Languages Linguist Elizabeth Little took a two-year trip across the U.S. in search of the country’s lost languages. The resulting book is Trip of the Tongue: Cross-Country Travels in Search of America’s Lost Languages.
